news_list.title: Lok Sabha polls begin tomorrow: 102 seats, 21 states and UTs, 1,625 candidates
news_list.description: The NDA and the INDIA alliance parties won 48 seats each of these 102 in the 2019 polls; Tamil Nadu, Uttarakhand to complete polling

news_list.title: Layers of faultlines in Uttarakhand politics: Brahmins to Thakurs, Dalits to Muslims, Kumaon to Garhwal
news_list.description: The numerical dominance of Thakurs and Brahmins, and their divide, lead to a delicate balance of power, with both BJP and Cong having consistently picked a CM from either of the two communities.

news_list.title: K C Venugopal returns to Kerala fray as Congress looks to settle score with CPI(M) in prestige battle
news_list.description: Alappuzha is the only seat out of Kerala's 20 which Cong-led UDF lost in 2019; this time BJP has fielded its firebrand leader Sobha Surendran while CPI(M) has retained its sitting MP.

news_list.title: In Uttarakhand villages, defence dreams dented by Agnipath concerns, but BJP remains a ‘clear choice’
news_list.description: In its Lok Sabha poll campaign, state Cong has raked up Agnipath to attack BJP, but the issue has not found traction as the party failed to build it up

news_list.title: In three-way Tamil Nadu battle, DMK in pole position amid challenge from AIADMK, BJP
news_list.description: DMK’s confidence stems from Stalin’s 'successful steering' of its alliance; the party faces tough fights with AIADMK in West TN and with BJP in Theni and Coimbatore

news_list.title: In Bengal battle round 1, TMC hopes to set the pace, retake north Bengal from BJP
news_list.description: Three seats up for polls on April 19 were all won by BJP in 2019, which TMC has been trying to wrest to gain upper hand in the region

news_list.title: Today in Politics: Campaign focus shifts to second phase; Amit Shah to hold roadshows, rally in Gandhinagar before filing nomination

news_list.title: In Tamil Nadu, BJP faces the twin trust deficit hurdle: resources and representation
news_list.description: The delimitation exercise could substantively expand the Lok Sabha strength based on demographic changes in the states.The likelihood that southern states will have a relatively lesser voice compared with Uttar Pradesh and Bihar post delimitation certainly doesn’t ring a bell among voters in Tamil Nadu.

news_list.title: Fatehpur Sikri: BJP MLA turns rebel, fields son against party nominee

news_list.title: Jat rumblings to anti-incumbency: Congress hopes Rajasthan halts a run
news_list.description: In Churu and Nagaur, Jats have kept both the parties guessing. Both the BJP and Congress have fielded Jats from the two seats.

news_list.title: ‘Our identity, our land, our jobs’: Backed into a corner, Mehbooba Mufti sets the campaign tone

news_list.title: Ashok Chavan: ‘Congress leadership’s knowledge of what’s happening in Maharashtra is questionable. Unfortunately, people like Nana Patole have made a mess’
news_list.description: 'These are untested waters. For years, I have worked with people under different circumstances. How they react, what they do, is a test for us too,’ BJP MP and ex-Cong CM tells The Indian Express

news_list.title: A second seat for Naveen Patnaik: Why BJD chief has chosen to contest from western Odisha

news_list.title: In Nagaur, Vasundhara Raje confidant Yunus Khan holds the key as BJP candidate faces uphill battle against Beniwal
news_list.description: As Jat votes are likely to be split evenly between BJP’s Jyoti Mirdha and INDIA’s Beniwal, Muslims and Meghwals would be the clincher with BJP trying to placate ex-party leader Yunus to get Muslim votes

news_list.title: ‘Why should I counter BJP on tukde-tukde? Lies need not be countered’: Kanhaiya Kumar

news_list.description: According to findings by Swiss NGO, Public Eye and International Baby Food Action Network (IBFAN), Nestle sold baby products with higher sugar content in less developed South Asian countries including India, and African and Latin American nations as compared to its markets in Europe.

news_list.title: Discomfited, annoyed by demand that RBI should be cheerleader for Govt: Former Governor
news_list.description: Duvvuri Subbarao, who worked in both the government and the RBI, has said, “There is little understanding and sensitivity within the government on the importance of central bank autonomy."

news_list.description: Swiggy Mall, which is currently operational in parts of Bengaluru, marked the company's foray into online retail.

news_list.description: The initial share-sale will be open for public subscription during April 23-25 and the bidding for anchor investors will open for a day on April 22, the company said in a statement.

news_list.title: Volumes of domestic mining, construction equipment industry may drop in FY25: Report
news_list.description: "ICRA expects FY2025 to see a 12-15 per cent year-on-year decline (which translates into volumes of 1.14-1.18 lakh units)," the rating agency said in a statement.

news_list.title: Flight operations from India to Dubai disrupted amid adverse weather conditions
news_list.description: India’s largest flight operator in terms of passenger volume, IndiGo, cancelled several of its flights to the desert kingdom. Similarly, Tata group-owned Air India, which operates 72 weekly flights from various cities to Dubai, cancelled its services

news_list.title: Bandhan Bank shares advance 1% after hitting lows in previous session
news_list.description: The shares have witnessed a downward trajectory since bank's MD and CEO Chandra Shekhar Ghosh announced his retirement from the top post upon completion of his current tenure on July 9, 2024.

news_list.title: Sensex, Nifty rebound in early trade after three sessions of decline
news_list.description: The 30-share BSE Sensex climbed 310.82 points to 73,254.50 in early trade. The NSE Nifty went up by 122.75 points to 22,270.65.

news_list.title: Rupee rises 12 paise to 83.49 against US dollar

news_list.title: Tesla again seeks shareholder approval for Musk’s 2018 pay voided by judge
news_list.description: The re-vote comes ahead of next week's quarterly earnings for Tesla, which is grappling with weak demand as well as a reputational hit to Musk from his political leanings and approval of an antisemitic conspiracy theory last year.

news_list.title: IMF calls for fiscal restraint in year with most elections ever
news_list.description: A record 88 countries, home to more than half of the world's population, have held or are holding national elections in 2024, the IMF said, noting that governments tend to spend more and tax less during election years.

news_list.title: Japan’s Nikkei settles below 38,000 points for first time since February
news_list.description: The Nikkei finished down 1.3% at 37,961.80, its lowest closing level since Feb. 14, and was on track for its biggest weekly loss since December 2022. The broader Topix declined 1.3% to 2663.15.

news_list.title: UK inflation slows by less than expected to 3.2% in March
news_list.description: Core inflation, which excludes energy, food and tobacco prices, also slowed to 4.2% from 4.5% in February.

news_list.title: Asian stocks in mixed territory as US Federal Reserve hints later timeline for rate cuts
news_list.description: The mixed reaction came after Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said at an event Tuesday that the central bank has been waiting to cut its main interest rate, which is at its highest level since 2001, because it first needs more confidence inflation is heading sustainably down to its 2% target.

news_list.title: US signals Venezuela oil sanctions relief at risk as deadline looms
news_list.description: Barring any last-minute concessions by President Maduro, the US has made clear it is not likely to renew a six-month license that granted the OPEC member partial sanctions relief from October.
